sub_title: PhD Candidate at 3mE, TU Delft | MSc., Aerospace Engineering (Aerodynamics), TU Delft | TNO | NIT Trichy | Aerodynamics | Aeroacoustics | Turbulence | FSI | Aeroelasticity | Multiphase Flows |
summary:
I am a PhD candidate, who is curious to know the world around him in different perspectives. I have collected experience in the field of research and would like to continue doing so in various other fields, gathering expertise as well as useful insights on them. Thus I would like to obtain greater experience in not just Mechanical, Chemical and Aerospace Engineering, but also in other fields from different people, as I am a firm believer of the notion "Everyone knows something". I strive to become an expert generalist one day, in order to make a positive difference for the people around me.

I am someone who is ready to put in extra efforts to understand anything pertaining to the task at hand, and also like guiding others with the knowledge I have gained to the best of my ability. 

My current interests include Fluid Mechanics, Aerodynamics (in particular, I'd like to delve into Aeroacoustics, Multiphase Flows & Fluid Structure Interaction). Control Systems and High Performance Computing are also my secondary interests.

For further details, I am available on G-Mail through my email ID: raviramesh26@gmail.com.

projects.title: Investigating the effect of femtosecond laser-fabricated grooves and coating on condensation heat transfer
projects.description: I was a part of the team that helped to write the introduction of the paper which has been published in the International Journal of Heat and Mass Transfer. I was also responsible for being a part of the team responsible for the  MATLAB coding for analyzing droplet parameters such departure diameter, departure frequency, coverage ratio etc, and gained elementary knowledge on image processing through this.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at 3mE, TU Delft | MSc., Aerospace Engineering (Aerodynamics), TU Delft | TNO | NIT Trichy | Aerodynamics | Aeroacoustics | Turbulence | FSI | Aeroelasticity | Multiphase Flows |

projects.title: Writing the CFD code of an unsteady non-Newtonian Couette Flow between two parallel plates
projects.description: An unsteady non-Newtonian fluid in a Couette flow between two parallel plates was modeled using a MATLAB code. The velocity profiles were obtained using the Gauss-Seidel approach using the finite volume method for discretization. The results were obtained for different time steps and for different types of fluids based on viscosity.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at 3mE, TU Delft | MSc., Aerospace Engineering (Aerodynamics), TU Delft | TNO | NIT Trichy | Aerodynamics | Aeroacoustics | Turbulence | FSI | Aeroelasticity | Multiphase Flows |

projects.title: Antagonistic arrangement of springs
projects.description: The main aim of this project was to model the antagonistic arrangement of springs subject to pretension on ANSYS Mechanical. The thermal behaviour of this project was studied for some time, as well as the stress-strain characteristics.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at 3mE, TU Delft | MSc., Aerospace Engineering (Aerodynamics), TU Delft | TNO | NIT Trichy | Aerodynamics | Aeroacoustics | Turbulence | FSI | Aeroelasticity | Multiphase Flows |

projects.title: Effect of aspect ratio on condensation heat transfer
projects.description: The main aim of this project is to obtain the variation in the condensation heat transfer of metal nanowires with varying aspect ratios. Experimental results are being obtained which will be incorporated in a research paper in a good journal soon.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at 3mE, TU Delft | MSc., Aerospace Engineering (Aerodynamics), TU Delft | TNO | NIT Trichy | Aerodynamics | Aeroacoustics | Turbulence | FSI | Aeroelasticity | Multiphase Flows |

projects.title: Fabrication of a gyrocar
projects.description: The main aim of this project is to fabricate a gyrocar using the basic principles of gyroscopic precession. This is a coursework project for the subject Mechanics of Machines - II.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at 3mE, TU Delft | MSc., Aerospace Engineering (Aerodynamics), TU Delft | TNO | NIT Trichy | Aerodynamics | Aeroacoustics | Turbulence | FSI | Aeroelasticity | Multiphase Flows |

projects.title: Force Analysis of a Murphy's bed
projects.description: The main aim of this project is to find out the various forces acting on Murphy's bed and analyzing them using the software MechAnalyzer developed by IIT Delhi. This is a coursework project done for the course Mechanics of Machines - I.

projects.title: Finding the surface energy of solids by using the contact angle of two liquids
projects.description: The project was a literature review of the various works which had occurred in the field of condensation heat transfer. We had a discussion on the same with my project team mates and guide, and this was used as the base for our future project.

MSc in Aerospace engineering (Aerodynamics) at TU Delft

profile_positions.description:
The project involves creating a lumped model using CFD analyses of the gasification process in conical (spouted) bubbling fluidized bed reactors. The project will involve funding from TU Delft and GIDARA Energy.

Supervisors: Prof. Johan Padding and Prof. Wiebren de Jong (TU Delft), Dr. Elyas Moghaddam (GIDARA Energy)
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description: Guided BSc students to solve problems in Thermodynamics in Dutch (Thermodynamica).
profile_positions.title: Docent

profile_positions.description: Guided 2nd year BSc students in the practicals of the course - Stromingsleer, Warmte en Thermodynamica.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: Solve different kinds of problems in different industries in order to improve my understanding of real-world challenges. Have so far worked with Avery Dennison and Nobian to provide desk research solutions.
profile_positions.title: Problem Solver

profile_positions.description: The idea behind organizing a mentor system in the Master programme is to create small groups, thus facilitating social cohesion, which is a very important extra impulse during the times of online education. Furthermore, it will be easier for the new master students to approach me as a mentor for questions regarding their study and how things are done.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Mentor

profile_positions.description:
For the thesis, the goal is to study the aerodynamics of an airfoil in deep stall, and compare those results with experimental and computational data in the literature.

As intermediate steps, I have to identify the sources of noise in an airfoil under deep stall conditions (AoA = 60°), and then obtain the unsteady pressure fluctuations from the CFD analysis. An appropriate DDES mesh for the airfoil and using a turbulence model on SU2, currently using the DDES approach with the S-A turbulence model in the RANS mode, and the SLA-SGS approach in the LES mode. Then, validating results with experimental data and other computational models from the literature are performed. The acoustics solver, having only the solid formulation of the FW-H equations, was also explored in SU2.

Supervisors: Dr. Francesco Avallone (TU Delft), Dr. Hüseyin Özdemir (TNO Petten)
profile_positions.title: Graduate Thesis Student

profile_positions.description:
My role is to learn SU2, an open source code based on C++ and Python, and run basic test cases using various turbulence approaches (RANS and DDES) primarily for my internship.

Supervisor: Dr. Hüseyin Özdemir
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Intern

profile_positions.description:
I have worked on optimizing the geometric parameters that affect the performance characteristics (such as power and thrust coefficients) of a vertical axis wind turbine, such as chord length of the airfoil cross-section, blade pitch, radius of the rotor etc. The airfoil to be used for this application was chosen using XFOIL and the analyses were performed on QBlade, a commercial software developed by TU Berlin. Graphs were later plotted to show the variation of these parameters on TecPlot 360.

Supervisor: Dr.-Ing. Galih Bangga
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
I have worked with ANSYS Fluent, in which I had simulated the nature of Colgate toothpaste on the vibrating membrane of a speaker with a given input frequency of vibration, giving an input using the ANSYS C language. A video showing the simulation was made for the same, and hence, proficiency in Fluent and in ANSYS C documentation was obtained.

Supervisor: Prof. Dr. Sandeep Saha
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Intern

volunteer_experiences.role: Vice Chairperson - Spic Macay Europe, Country Coordinator - Spic Macay Netherlands
volunteer_experiences.description:
Helped organize SPIC MACAY Europe's first inter-country concert circuit in The Netherlands, Germany, and Switzerland
Helped register SPIC MACAY Europe as a Stichting in Delft, The Netherlands
Part of the Grants Team to oversee grant applications at the European Commission and country levels alike

Helped coordinate activities for raising funds from the Delft municipality (Gemeente Delft) and organizing concerts for the first-ever university concert by SPIC MACAY Europe at TU Delft, The Netherlands
Helped to establish other European chapters, including Norway, Sweden, The UK, Spain and currently Luxembourg & Italy.
